attributes.action: Instigate national enquiry into grooming gangs
attributes.additional_details: Successive governments of been reticent to open an open and honest dialogue with the nation about the behaviour of some immigrant classes in the UK for fear of generating a public backlash, or being accused of racism. The longer there is silence on this subject, the more distrust will arise with government to protect 'all' citizens under the rule of law.
attributes.background: Some immigrant groups display behaviour that is unacceptable within our laws, and leads to the suspicion that there exists a two-tier policing system; one for the immigrants, and one for the rest of UK.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/711976
